title: READ BACK | GA Eagles’ European comeback: an thrilling night in Deventer
text:
It is over in De Adelaarshorst. After an thrilling night, Go Forward Eagles – SK Brann ends in 0-0. A combined feeling prevails in Deventer. Go Forward Eagles failed to search out the web a number of occasions earlier than half-time, however within the ultimate section of the second half they may very well be pleased to not concede a objective.
The return match in Norway is scheduled for subsequent Thursday, August 1 (beginning at 7:00 PM).
As soon as once more, Llansana forgets to intervene decisively and this time it’s deadly for Go Forward Eagles. The occasional defender utterly misjudges an extended ball and pulls the emergency brake: pink. Go Forward Eagles need to survive the damage time with one man much less.
The free kick on the sting of the penalty space results in the Deventer wall. Everybody in De Adelaarshorst breathes a sigh of aid.
He may have had a hat trick to his identify, however for now the counter is on the hateful zero. Bobby Adekanye will get one hundred percent likelihood to shoot Go Forward Eagles into the lead. Head to head with Brann goalkeeper Dyngeland he runs into the goalie. Adekanye will get up screaming a number of extra occasions tonight.
A double substitution at Go Forward Eagles. Jakob Breum and Joris Kramer make method for Robbin Weijenberg and newcomer Calvin Twigt, who was acquired from FC Volendam this summer season. Midfielder Enric Llansana strikes a line again and takes place subsequent to Jamal Amofa within the coronary heart of the protection.
Dean James goes to the bottom: the left again has cramp. After nearly three quarters of the match, fatigue is beginning to set in among the many small group of gamers at Go Forward Eagles. And the squad on the bench is slim. Along with the departure of key gamers Bas Kuipers, Willum Willumsson and Philippe Rommens, coach Paul Simonis can also be battling many accidents. Mathis Suray, Oliver Edvardsen, Julius Dirksen, Gerrit Nauber and Thibo Baeten aren’t there. James has now been changed by Luca Everink.
Will the failure to capitalize on the numerous probabilities earlier than half-time show deadly for Simonis’ group?
Regardless of Go Forward Eagles enjoying at European degree for the primary time in years, De Adelaarshorst shouldn’t be offered out. Empty seats on the primary stand.
Whereas the rain falls on the Vetkampstraat, Go Forward Eagles bites again once more. Photographs from Jakob Breum and substitute Finn Stokkers fly simply previous the objective of SK Brann goalkeeper Mathias Dyngeland.
Within the second half, Go Forward Eagles has much more hassle with SK Brann. Are the gamers of the Deventer group getting drained? Within the meantime, quantity ten Søren Tengstedt is changed by Finn Stokkers.
The primary yellow card of the match goes to SK Brann. Emil Kornvig kicks Enric Llansana the wrong way up and interrupts a counter assault by Go Forward Eagles.
Whereas fireworks are being set off outdoors the stadium, the second half between Go Forward Eagles and SK Brann has kicked off.
After first half of Go Forward Eagles, the half-time whistle has sounded. The group of coach Paul Simonis has the higher of the sport, however forgets a very powerful factor in soccer towards SK Brann: changing probabilities into objectives.
Thore Pedersen takes intention at Jeffrey de Lange’s objective. The shot from about twenty metres is expertly saved by the Go Forward Eagles goalkeeper.
After a difficult free kick by Go Forward Eagles, Mats Deijl seems free within the sixteen. The captain of mis-headed the ball. A minute later, Adekanye will get one other nice likelihood, however the rating stays 0-0…
Now it’s Bobby Adekanye who presses his nostril to the window. The suitable winger comes inside, however curls the ball simply large.
What an opportunity! After transfer by Bobby Adekanye, Søren Tengstedt seems unmarked in entrance of the Norwegian objective, however the quantity ten of GA Eagles shoots straight at goalkeeper Mathias Dyngeland.
The primary massive likelihood of the match is for the guests. Half-hearted intervention by Enric Llansana is sort of deadly for GA Eagles, however Jeffrey de Lange exhibits as soon as once more why the goalkeeper is an attention-grabbing switch goal for a lot of golf equipment.
Ukrainian referee Denys Leonidovych Shurman has blown his whistle for the primary time tonight. The European conflict between Go Forward Eagles and SK Brann is underway!
Listed below are the gamers, let’s begin!
The rise at GA Eagles – SK Brann © Oost/Job Vaarhorst
Full strains on the gates of De Adelaarshorst simply minutes earlier than kick-off. Not everyone seems to be inside but.
The opponent’s line-up. What number of have you learnt?
In 25 minutes, the European duel will lastly start.
Coach Paul Simonis begins with the next line-up.
In simply over an hour, the sport will kick off within the stunning soccer theatre known as De Adelaarshorst.
The Deventer followers depart De Brink and head in direction of the stadium.
In a short while, Go Forward Eagles will begin the Convention League match towards the Norwegian SK Brann. From De Adelaarshorst, we look forward to the European poster with Tijmen van Wissing, Jan van Staa and Paul Bosvelt. Watch the printed beneath.
Home analyst Jan van Staa is in fact additionally current. ‘Highway to Wroclaw’. The ultimate of the Convention League will probably be performed within the Polish metropolis subsequent yr. A really lengthy highway for Go Forward.
Home analyst Jan van Staa © Oost/Job Vaarhorst
The gamers of Go Forward Eagles trickle into De Adelaarshorst. One other hour and a half till kick-off.
Jeffrey de Lange © Oost/Job Vaarhorst The gamers enter De Adelaarshorst © Oost/Job Vaarhorst
The Norwegian enclave of SK Brann makes itself heard.
GA Eagles defender Gerrit Nauber, who’s injured and due to this fact not within the choice tonight, walks via Deventer along with his household.
The supporters of Go Forward Eagles put together for the atmospheric Brink.
Go Forward Eagles supporters warming up
The followers from Norway are having a good time in Deventer, the place they have been warmly welcomed.
Followers from Norway get pleasure from themselves in Deventer
The flags of UEFA and Norway have been raised for the event on the entrance of De Adelaarshorst
The environment is beginning to get going at De Brink. Simply over three hours till kick-off!
Even within the French solar the red-yellow colors flutter.
The Brink in Deventer is slowly filling up. From younger to outdated.
The younger red-yellow guard is current at De Brink © Oost/Bart Kieft
Alderman Marcel Elferink of Deventer was current to obtain the Norwegian supporters from Bergen. “It is an amazing social gathering. That is how we supposed it. To arrange it like this. To obtain them right here and welcome them to Deventer,” he says cheerfully.
Elferink himself may even journey to Bergen subsequent week. Deventer and town in Norway have historic ties. “Because the Center Ages. There are all types of traces within the metropolis that remind us of that.”
Deventer councillor Elferink receives followers from Norway
The 4 hundred Norwegian followers of SK Brann have now reached the Davo brewery in Deventer. And the environment is already good.
The environment is already good among the many Norwegian followers of SK Brann
Preparations are already in full swing on the Brink in Deventer.
Final Monday, De Oosttribune, the soccer speak present of Oost, returned from summer season recess. Go Forward director Jan Willem van Dop was a visitor to look forward to tonight’s match, amongst different issues.
The buses with SK Brann supporters journey from Schiphol to Deventer. 4 hundred Norwegian followers are anticipated at Brouwerij Davo from 14:00. The primary supporters from Norway with their very own transport have already arrived.
Supporters of SK Brann arrived in Deventer © Oost/Bart Kieft
The stress for tonight is already palpable among the many die-hard Eagles supporters.
Go Forward Eagles’ earlier European journey, in 2015 towards Hungarian Ferencváros, resulted in a stupendous documentary.
Go Forward Eagles can also be intently adopted overseas. Within the Kruger Nationwide Park in South Africa, probably the most well-known wild animals, the so-called ‘Huge 5’, at this time encounter a proud customer in Go Forward apparel.
A lovely sight. The Municipality of Deventer had the Wilhelmina Bridge coloured red-yellow final night time.
By now a tried and examined recipe for European matches and nearly a practice: setting off fireworks in the course of the night time on the gamers’ lodge of the opponent to disturb their sleep. On the Van der Valk lodge in Deventer, the place the gamers and workers of SK Brann spent the night time on Wednesday, fireworks have been set off by supporters of Go Forward Eagles final night time.
GA Eagles supporters set off fireworks at Van der Valk
After the adventures of 1965 and 2015, the Deventer group can put together for European matches once more on this nonetheless younger season. What classes will be discovered from the European matches of 59 and 9 years in the past respectively? Within the article beneath, former goalkeeper Nico van Zoghel and former coach Dennis Demmers inform tales from the outdated (pink and yellow) field.
The pitch is new, the stadium has been renovated and the choice has undergone a radical metamorphosis. As well as, the brand new coach Paul Simonis can also be lacking a number of fundamental gamers. A removed from optimum preparation, however however the boldness is excessive at GA Eagles within the run-up to the European duel with SK Brann.
Paul Simonis on the press convention previous to the match towards SK Brann: “We’re prepared”
What sort of membership is SK Brann and what can the group from Deventer anticipate towards the Norwegians? Brann certified for the preliminary rounds of the Convention League by ending second within the Norwegian competitors final yr. A outstanding achievement, as a result of a yr earlier it was nonetheless enjoying on the second degree in Norway. Brann did win the cup event as a primary division group and was due to this fact allowed to enter Europe final season.
On this weblog we rely all the way down to the Convention League match between Go Forward Eagles and the Norwegian SK Brann. And from 18:00 the printed of De Oosttribune begins on Radio Oost. With the reside report from De Adelaarshorst from 18:30. Every part in regards to the European duel may also be adopted on oost.nl and within the Oost app.
After an exciting denouement in Utrecht, European soccer was secured on the finish of final season © Orange Photos

author: Laura Osman; The Canadian Press
title: Ottawa declassifies more details from Rodal report on Nazi war criminals in Canada
text:
OTTAWA — The federal government has released previously classified details from a report that outlines the extent to which Canada provided a safe haven to former Nazis during the Cold War.
Ottawa faced renewed calls for greater transparency about the presence of war criminals in Canada after parliamentarians inadvertently gave two standing ovations last fall to a man who fought in a Nazi unit in the Second World War.
Yaroslav Hunka, who fought for the Waffen-SS Galicia Division, a voluntary unit created by the Nazis to help fight the Soviet Union, was welcomed to the House of Commons last fall to hear a speech by Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy.
The report by researcher Alti Rodal, known as the Rodal report, was prepared as part of a Commission of Inquiry on War Criminals in Canada in 1985 and was intended to provide the commission with information on the historical policies and circumstances that led to the presence of Nazi war criminals in Canada.
It was initially released under the Access to Information Act in heavily censored form in 1987, and more details were made public last summer in response to a Freedom of Information request by B’nai Brith Canada.
The newly released and nearly complete version makes 15 previously classified pages public, the immigration minister's director of communications, Aissa Diop, said in a statement Thursday.
"While additional information that is no longer sensitive due to the passage of time can now be released, some information still remains protected in accordance with the Access to Information Act and the Privacy Act," Immigration, Refugees and Citizenship Canada said in a news release Thursday.
There are no individuals identified in the newly released version of the document, but it does include information Canada received in confidence from foreign governments, details previously protected under solicitor client privilege, as well as information that would harm international affairs and the enforcement of Canadian laws, Diop said.
“Those who suffered under Nazi Germany and their descendants want transparency when it comes to this shameful chapter in our history," Immigration Minister Marc Miller said in a statement Thursday.
Rodal's report concludes that in the decade following the war, there was “ample opportunity” for war criminals and Nazi collaborators to enter Canada.
B’nai Brith Canada has advocated for the release of the full document since the 1980s, and filed several requests under Access to Information Laws in the past year, which the group says the government repeatedly denied.
“We welcome this almost complete disclosure of the Rodal Report,” David Matas, who represented the group during the commission, said in a statement Wednesday.
Though it has been 79 years since the Second World War and 37 years since Rodal's work was completed, Matas said ongoing mass atrocities and efforts by perpetrators to seek haven in Canada lend contemporary relevance to the report.
"We cannot learn from the past unless we know the past. The almost complete disclosure of the Rodal Report is an important step in coming to grips with our past and applying its lessons for the present," he said.
This report by The Canadian Press was first published Feb. 1, 2024.
Laura Osman, The Canadian Press

author: Redacción
title: Chilango - Conagua presenta proyecto hídrico para Edomex
text:
Como parte de los proyectos de infraestructura hídrica, el Gobierno de México invertirá 2 mil 516 millones de pesos en 2025 para mejorar los servicios de agua y drenaje en la zona oriente del Edomex.
Durante la conferencia mañanera de la presidenta Claudia Sheinbaum, el director general de la Comisión Nacional del Agua (Conagua), Efraín Morales López, presentó los proyectos de infraestructura hídrica previstos para este año, los cuales contarán con una inversión inicial de 15 mil millones de pesos.
Se trata de 17 proyectos estratégicos y un plan maestro que contempla una inversión sexenal de 122 mil 600 millones de pesos.
Como parte de estos proyectos, se destinarán 2 mil 516 millones de pesos en 2025 para diez municipios de la zona oriente del Edomex.
“Es una zona que cuenta con muchas dificultades en materia de agua potable y también de inundaciones. Se tiene contemplado para 2025 que se inviertan 2 mil 516 millones de pesos. Se va a beneficiar a una población de 6.4 millones”, dijo Efraín Morales.
El titular de Conagua explicó que 555 millones de pesos provienen de la inversión municipal; 544 millones serán aportados por el gobierno estatal y mil 417 millones por la Federación.
Dijo que esto derivó en 101 acciones: 64 enfocadas en agua potable y 37 en alcantarillado.
La zona oriente del
— Efraín Morales López (@Efrainmoralesl)[#EdoMéx]es un ejemplo de cómo estamos colaborando con los municipios este 2025, ya que estamos trabajando en 101 proyectos estratégicos con una inversión de los tres órdenes de gobierno de 2,516 MDP. Ya empezamos con la construcción del Colector Solidaridad,…[pic.twitter.com/zvYVrIH7Xf][March 12, 2025]
¿Cuáles son los 10 municipios del Edomex donde se realizarán obras hídricas?
Los diez municipios del Edomex donde se ejecutarán obras para mejorar la infraestructura hídrica son:
- Chalco
- Chicoloapan
- Chimalhuacán
- Ecatepec
- Ixtapaluca
- La Paz
- Nezahualcóyotl
- Texcoco
- Tlalnepantla
- Valle de Chalco
Morales señaló que entre las obras en marcha está la del Colector Solidaridad, en Valle de Chalco, cuyo objetivo es mitigar los problemas de inundaciones que han afectado a los habitantes de Chalco.
Conagua anuncia proyectos hídricos para CDMX, Edomex e Hidalgo
En octubre, la Conagua iniciará trabajos en la Zona Metropolitana del Valle de México para mejorar el abastecimiento de agua en la CDMX, el Edomex e Hidalgo.
Efraín Morales, director general de Conagua explicó que se invertirán 50 mil millones de pesos en este proyecto, de los cuales 4 mil 100 millones serán aplicados en 2025 con recursos del gobierno federal y estatal.
El director de la Conagua afirmó que esta iniciativa beneficiará a 21.6 millones de personas.
Explicó que el plan hídrico para el Valle de México también contempla acciones para la prevención de inundaciones y el saneamiento del río Tula, así como “un plan de justicia” para la zona del Valle del Mezquital.
“Este es el proyecto de la Zona Metropolitana del Valle de México, es un proyecto muy ambicioso que tiene como objetivo principal desarrollar proyectos para el abastecimiento de agua en la Ciudad de México, en el Estado de México y también en Hidalgo”, dijo.
“Además, contempla la atención, tanto para prevención de inundaciones como de saneamiento del río Tula y se tiene contemplado un Plan de Justicia para la zona del Valle del Mezquital. Se van a invertir 50 mil millones de pesos durante todo el sexenio; ya se tienen 4 mil 100 millones que provienen de recursos estatales y federales, que es con lo que vamos a iniciar este año”, agregó.
— Gobierno de México (@GobiernoMX)
[#MañaneraDelPueblo]desde Palacio Nacional. Miércoles 12 de marzo 2025[https://t.co/iGfdcNt0yQ][March 12, 2025]
Gobierno de México invertirá 122 mil mdp en infraestructura hídrica
El Gobierno de México invertirá 122 mil 600 millones de pesos durante el sexenio en proyectos de infraestructura hídrica.
“Es un proyecto muy ambicioso de obras estratégicas y obras municipales que conjuntan: presupuesto municipal, estatal y federal, además de las obras estratégicas”, destacó la presidenta Claudia Sheinbaum.
El director de la Conagua, Efraín Morales, detalló que se trata de 17 proyectos en diversas regiones del país y un plan maestro basado en un diagnóstico de las necesidades hídricas a nivel municipal.
“Tiene como objetivo fundamental garantizar el derecho humano al agua. La inversión total a lo largo de todo el sexenio será de alrededor de 122 mil 600 millones de pesos; este año vamos a tener una inversión inicial en esos proyectos, de 15 mil millones, y esto va a beneficiar a una población de 36 millones de personas”, explicó.
— Conagua (@conagua_mx)
[#Comunicado]
Impulsa[@GobiernoMX], inversión de casi 123 mil MDP para 17 proyectos estratégicos de[#Agua], que beneficiarán a 36 millones de personas.
Más información en:[https://t.co/SpBTZdIdPu][pic.twitter.com/Hngro50QTU][March 12, 2025]
 ¿Cuándo abrirá el Trolebús Chalco-Santa Martha? Así van las obras de la ruta que conectará CDMX y Edomex

author: Carmen Torres González
title: Nombran a The Eras Tour de Taylor Swift como la gira del siglo - Noticias de Yucatán
text:
Nombran a The Eras Tour de Taylor Swift como la gira del siglo
QUERÉTARO, Qro., 23 de enero de 2025.- Taylor Swift será galardonada con el prestigioso título de Gira del Siglo en los iHeartRadio Music Awards 2025, reconociendo el éxito sin precedentes de su The Eras Tour.
La ceremonia se llevará a cabo el 17 de marzo en el Dolby Theatre de Los Ángeles y será transmitida en vivo por Fox a las 8 p.m. ET.
El Eras Tour, que inició el 17 de marzo de 2023, recorrió más de 50 ciudades a nivel mundial, culminando el 8 de diciembre de 2024 en Vancouver, Canadá. Durante este periodo, la gira generó ingresos estimados en 2.2 mil millones de dólares, estableciendo un nuevo récord en la industria musical.
El texto original de este artículo fue publicado por la Agencia Quadratín en la siguiente dirección: https://queretaro.quadratin.com.mx/nombran-a-the-eras-tour-de-taylor-swift-como-la-gira-del-siglo/

organizations.name: The Eras Tour de Taylor Swift

title: VIDEO: Regionali Abruzzo, Marsilio: Avevamo promesso che andavamo a dormire con 10 punti di vantaggio - ilGiornale.it
text: [Cronaca locale](https://www.ilgiornale.it/sezioni/cronaca-locale-167540.html) Regionali Abruzzo, Marsilio: Avevamo promesso che andavamo a dormire con 10 punti di vantaggio11 Marzo 2024 - 02:54 Regionali Abruzzo, Marsilio: Avevamo promesso che li mandavamo a dormire "Il comizio di venerdì promettendo due cose Uno è che questa sera l'unica sarda che avrebbe festeggiato sarebbe stata mia moglie. La seconda che all'una, massimo le due andavamo tutti a dormire con dieci punti di vantaggio. Qualcuno ci ha sottovalutato e a Mezzanotte ancora raccontava di un testa a testa che non è mai esistito ", le parole di Marsilio, riconfermato Presidente dell'Abruzzo. author: , The Enquirer
title: Heavy rain, strong winds coming to Cincinnati area Thursday afternoon
text: Greater Cincinnati under severe thunderstorm watch; heavy rains, damaging winds possible

author: FOX 9
title: Minnesota weather: A pleasant and fairly sunny day Friday | FOX 9 Minneapolis-St. Paul
text:
The Brief Above-average temperatures stick around for another day with a high of 73 degrees in the Twin Cities metro. A cool down is on the way as temperatures dip into the 50s this weekend and into the start of next week. The weekend will stay mostly dry for the metro, but there is a possibility of seeing a few drips on Saturday. MINNEAPOLIS (FOX 9) - Friday brings pleasant weather with highs in the 70s, but cooler, more fall-like temperatures arrive for the weekend.
Friday forecast After a warm Thursday with highs reaching the 80s, a cold front is making its way in. It will still be a pleasant day with temperatures in the low 70s for the Twin Cities metro and 60s across northern Minnesota. Expect a light, northerly breeze at 10-15 mph.
Morning cloud cover thins out for afternoon sunshine, but wildfire smoke lingering in the upper atmosphere, possibly through the weekend, can give the sky a hazy look at times.
Cloud coverage returns Friday night into Saturday morning, and overnight conditions stay relatively mild, with temperatures in the mid-40s.
Cool down this weekend Cooler temperatures arrive for the weekend, making it feel more like fall. On Saturday, expect highs in the mid-60s and late-day sunshine. Sunday will be chillier with widespread highs in the 50s and brisk northerly winds.
On Saturday, the Twin Cities metro may experience light rain in the morning and into the lunch hour. Northeastern Minnesota will have a greater chance for heavier rain Saturday night and into Sunday, with a slight possibility of some snowflakes.
The below-average temperatures continue into the week, and we could see our first frost of the season. Temperatures rebound into the upper 60s and lower 70s before the end of the week.
Here's a look at your seven-day forecast:

author: LA NACION
title: Horóscopo de Virgo de hoy: viernes 29 de Diciembre de 2023 - LA NACION
text:
No permita que los miedos por frustraciones pasadas obstaculicen su impulso creativo. Evite detenerse en este momento porque en poco tiempo hallará la solución a ese problema. Fechas: 24 de Agosto al 23 de Septiembre
Qué le espera a Virgo el viernes 29 de Diciembre Amor: Bríndele ternura y compresión a ese familiar que necesita contención emocional. No dude y por la tarde llámelo para ver queées lo que necesita y en qué puede ayudarlo.
Riqueza: Puede hallar el apoyo que está necesitando para terminar su proyecto en ese compañero de trabajo. Tome contacto con él y pídale ayuda.
Bienestar: Sería bueno que alivie la tensión y busque una manera para descontracturarse. Investigue por la web alguna actividad o técnica que lo relaje.
Qué decía el horóscopo de Virgo en el día de ayer Sería bueno que acepte los consejos que reciba de la gente que lo quiere, pero para ello evite negarse. Lo ayudarán a cambiar su forma de pensar y actuar.
Amor: Intente expresar con libertad la pasión que tiene dentro de su corazón. De esa forma, logrará recibir recíprocamente una entrega total de su pareja.
Riqueza: Respete y hágase respetar por sus compañeros de trabajo. Intente incorporar nuevas pautas laborales para construir bases sólidas en los negocios.
Bienestar: Sorpréndase a usted mismo con un día diferente. Busque conocer un nuevo lugar que le inspire el alma. Esta noche, invite y comparta con alguien su amor por el arte.
Consultá el horóscopo de todos los signos del zodiaco. Otras predicciones para hoy :
Aries | Tauro | Géminis | Cáncer | Leo | Virgo | Libra | Escorpio | Sagitario | Capricornio | Acuario | Piscis |
LA NACION Seguí leyendo

author: La rédaction
title: Cyclone Chido: Mayotte en alerte rouge ce vendredi soir, de violentes rafales et des pluies intenses attendues - Var-Matin
text:
"C'est un événement inédit, d'une extrême violence, les vents pourront dépasser 180 km/h" , a expliqué François-Xavier Bieuville lors d'une conférence de presse. Le préfet a appelé les personnes logées dans des habitations précaires, très nombreuses dans le département le plus pauvre de France, à se confiner dans l'un des 71 centres d'hébergement ouverts par les autorités.
Ces centres, situés dans les établissements scolaires et gymnases, "seront ouverts à tous" , a-t-il assuré.
Le cyclone Chido, qui se situe actuellement à environ 500 km au nord-est de Mayotte, est un "cyclone tropical intense" explique Météo-France, qui prévoit "de violentes rafales de vents, des pluies intenses, des vagues submersives couplées à une surélévation de la mer".
Ces conditions météorologiques fortement dégradées entraînent "un risque de ruissellement et d'inondation, et une houle marine qui peut avoir des effets importants sur le littoral" a ajouté François-Xavier Bieuville, qui a enjoint les bateaux à "impérativement rejoindre la terre ferme".
Circulation interdite, aéroport fermé Toute circulation sur la voie publique sera interdite à partir de 22h et l'aéroport de Dzaoudzi sera fermé à partir de 20H00 (18H00 heure de Paris), a précisé le préfet.
La dernière barge, qui relie Dzaoudzi à Mamoudzou, partira à 17h30.
Le ministère de l'Intérieur avait annoncé jeudi l'envoi à Mayotte de 110 professionnels de la sécurité civile depuis l'île de La Réunion. Tous les établissements scolaires de l'archipel sont fermés vendredi et samedi.
L'archipel de Mayotte, relativement épargné par les cyclones, avait déjà été touché par le cyclone Belna en 2019, qui n'avait cependant pas fait de dégât majeur.
LIRE LES COMMENTAIRES
